There are texts of him acting as if he loves and offering marriage to a women if she flies out to Romania. I assume the other victims have similar texts.

> "It was my job to make women fall in love with me" 

>"None of them were in the adult entertainment industry before they met me"

2.author: MyJawHurtsALot
2.body:
>Yeah these appeals are not public your citing speculation.

The court has given information to a number of Romanian news outlets about the sessions and appeals, including access to the whole initial document. They are official court sources. 

The Tate quotes are public and visible at source.

2.body:

It's mostly summaries of documents in the articles anyway, so there's not to much legalese to worry about.

2.author: MyJawHurtsALot

2.author: Electrical-Ad2379
2.body: What's your partners thoughts on Tate?

2.author: MyJawHurtsALot
2.body:
I mean, upon reading all the information they dont have a particularly high opinion.

But this is literally just factual reporting on what has gone down in the court sessions and what documents say. It's not really open to interpretation.

Go read some Romanian articles and make sure to click and follow the stories to their source. Try to find the most primary source possible for any story. Even a lot of the west's articles will link to one of those reports. It's good advice in general to do this tbf.

2.author: MyJawHurtsALot
2.body:
Views on what? I'm already translating it through Google, an algorithmic translator. I already know 90% of what it's trying to say. She's only confirming what the ai translator is already saying and correcting small grammar mistakes.

There's not much to lie about when it says "the document says lawyer x did y". It's not like it's a particularly complicated sentence structure is it? These articles are literally written to be easily understandable and thus translatable .

But no, we both know you're arguing in bad faith. Why else would you accuse my partner of lying to me over something so inconsequential as grammar.

9.author: RagicalUnicorn
9.body: You sure are writing your own little narrative and projecting an awful lot here. I'm sorry I knew what subsonic ammo was? Talk about unhinged..

9.author: ucanaleaysbekinder
9.body:
More like unhinched because I was just doing a little Tony Hinchcliffe bit there. We do a little trolling, it's called we do a little trolling.

Since you're still replying...

"Fun fact, suppressors don't work at all like in the movies. They primarily get rid of muzzle flash, and while they decrease the sound slightly you should still be using ear protection."

With subsonic ammo, some suppressed guns do work like in movies. Most suppressed guns work almost like in movies.

"So firstly, it's not about your ears or neighbours (and how many people have shooting ranges in their homes?),"

With subsonic ammo the noise isn't enough to warrant hearing protection in most cases. This means being more aware of people around you while shooting and in home defense you won't blast your ears shooting an intruder or aggressive animal. Many people in America with land set up a shooting range, and even in cities people make ranges in their basements. I know people with both.

"secondly it decreases range and accuracy. So if youre shooting for sport and serious your wearing muffs and would want to fuck up your shot why?"

Subsonic ammo doesn't suffer the same lack of accuracy as regular rounds. It definitely decreases range but it could still hit a target 100m away. In home defense or just shooting steel plates at the range with a pistol, it's typically 10 meters maybe 50 meters max. Most celebrities are not shooting for sport anyway.

"Like the pig hunting example, lot of this stuff comes off as really dumb pure cope arguments"

I don't know the example you're referring to, but pig hunting is a dumb argument for suppressors. The subsonic ammo is only good for hunting smaller game. 

"and I believe the reality has a lot more to do with egos and childish bullshit than any kind of 'need'."

We are talking about a photo of Jeffrey Star plastered in designer with his NFL boyfriend so yeah... 😅 he probably doesn't want to mess up his hair and makeup with muffs. For the vast majority of people, a suppressed pistol isn't a need but rather a luxury item to have fun with and show off. Barely squeezing a finger and hearing a plate of steel go 'ding' without all the 'bang'. 

My whole point is subsonic ammo is a thing, and if you weren't so set on your beliefs you could have looked into it and learned something. If it really matters to you, my degree ranks as one of the hardest majors with careers in many fields and strong annual salaries. One of my courses covered subsonic and supersonic projectiles. You sure wrote your own little narrative too.

20.author: PloughDough
20.body:
As examples, Australians have historically treated their indigenous population (Aboriginals) a lot worse than we have in NZ (Māori).
Our gay marriage bill went through parliament relatively unchallenged whereas it was a really ugly public battle and vote in Australia.
We understand the benefits of multiculturalism here, have much higher integration and less suburbs or areas that consist of a particular race or culture (wealth aside).
These are all my takes obviously but overall I’m really proud of us as a country.

20.author: Hoyasnaxagurl22

Americans are nowhere close to eliminating our mass shooting and gun obsession disease. Also NZ was the first country to give women the vote (Kate Shephard!). You guys seem lovely. A friend of mine from school in California lives there now because her parents are kiwis and she went to get her Masters there. Much love to y’all!!

21.body:
Do you know what an apostrophe s is even used for? It's used when there's a noun that has a possession

Jeffree star's boyfriend - the boyfriend of Jeffree Star

Jeffree stars' boyfriend - the boyfriend of Jeffree Stars

Jeffree Stars boyfriend - no real meaning here and this is what H3 used in the description.

Can also be used as Jeffree Star is. so...

Jeffree Star's the worst - Jeffree Star is the worst.

21.author: JFKussy
21.body: Oh yeah fuck me, I’m an idiot

22.author: BINGBONG2BINGBONG
22.body:
Sorry about that! I didn't mean to upset you. I don't know your medical history and I'm not trying to make assumptions. 

I though I saw someone that could be in need and thought I should reach out. If I misread that then I'm sorry! I'd rather reach out and be wrong, than not reach out and be right. :)

Take care!

22.author: leilahs
22.body: Fair enough, thank you for the apology. Have a good day. Im gonna go film a music video lmfao <3

22.author: leilahs
22.body: Also for context to further quell any concerns i had been up all night working on other dance routines haha. After i smoked i was v tired and this was my third time refilming so yee. Hope i didnt come across as aggressive previously- just get upset when people misinterpret my joy :) u seem lovely though, thank you for trying to reach out

24.author: TheDawawa
24.body: It's fine.  I don't think she was doing a gimmick. I think she wanted a pic and maybe she could have picked a little better time, instead of mid show, but hey. That's just me.  They weren't performing brain surgery, so at the end of the day, oh well.

24.author: poe-tay-t0e
24.body: I gotcha… i see it more as “there’s a camera on me and i am doing a show with a lot of ‘clout’ and it’s my job to be hot and cunty and ‘clout farm’ so i’m going to play it up.” but to be fair to you, in most circumstances + for most people who I don’t think are performing that influencer role, I would agree that it’d be rude to do that on a podcast. but you right, they’re not performing brain surgery and it’s not the end of the world :)

Yeah. You could be right. 

I admire you for this civil exchange of thoughts and perspectives. It was enjoyable.

27.author: dairy_free_bacon
27.body: lol, I don't think you even know what gaffe means.

27.author: foxesinsoxes
27.body:
Using it in the silly context Ethan does. Do you need me to word it for you differently to answer?

How is it funny to say someone is scamming their fans?

27.author: dairy_free_bacon
27.body:
you didn't word it differently, you completely changed the question.

a gaffe is not the same as saying something is funny.

a gaffe is a fuck up, a mistake, a blunder, like making a tiny ass joke to a bunch a people who are too far up Ethan's ass.

27.author: foxesinsoxes
27.body:
Again, using it in the silly context Ethan does.

So, I’ll ask a second time- how is it funny to say someone is scamming their fans? 🥰

27.author: dairy_free_bacon
27.body:
lol, using it in the silly context?

you don't completely change the meaning of words just bcz your "being silly".

they still mean what they mean.

27.author: foxesinsoxes
27.body:
Awwww OP can’t answer the question- looks like they realized they’re a knob for saying it’s a “joke” to say they’re scamming fans. 😝

Eta: very ironic you saying words mean what they mean when you’re trying to double back on your whole dumb post 😂

27.author: dairy_free_bacon
27.body:
lmfao, okay.

once again only king Ethan, king of the gaffes and the goofs is allowed to make a joke.

it was literally a throwaway one liner. 

if you can't see that, that's fine but it's the same vain of humor as the podcast so im surprised that y'all literally took it as an attack.

I literally don't have time to sit and explain what makes a joke funny. That being said I can also accept that my joke didn't land with this audience. that's fine.

​

I'm just gonna hope his reddit using fan base skews a bit younger or something... 

y'all need some life experience.

27.author: foxesinsoxes
27.body:
It’s the definitiveness of “it’s been this long and they haven’t said anything about it” and then the “joke”. None of it comes off as a joke, it just comes off as another asshole accusing them of scamming- which happens regularly. 

Your right, your joke didn’t land. That’s not a problem on our fault, that’s on your’s lmao

27.author: dairy_free_bacon
27.body:
there was a bit of actual truth to my joke.

bcz yeah, it really had been ages since I'd heard about the golden ticket.. I wanted to know what happened, I wondered if it maybe it was a scam. and while asking about what happened in an attempt to gain the correct info I joked that maybe it was a scam.   
but, so what?

I wasn't accusing him of anything.   
I wasn't trying to rally people together to crucify Ethan for being a scammer. I wasn't drafting a letter to the fucking FTC.

I asked a question and made a joke on a subreddit for a comedy podcast. 

if you want to take that as an attack go ahead.

27.author: foxesinsoxes
27.body:
I mean… you were kinda accusing him of not following through and you just admitted that by saying there was truth to the “joke”, yeah? 

I just think it’s weird as a fan to add to the constant “Ethan/Hila/TF/anything involved with them is scamming” and then try the “it’s just a joke” before finally admitting there was some truth and you thought they might actually be scamming.

27.author: dairy_free_bacon
27.body:
lol, it was obvious that there was some truth behind the joke though?

pretty much all jokes are coming from a place of truth wether that be an observation or what have you.

yes it was a joke.

you're acting like it was some kind of call to action.

it's really telling that im not even allowed to be the tiniest bit critical or questioning of anything h3 does.

it's pretty sad.

27.author: foxesinsoxes
27.body: Yeah it is pretty sad making jokes about the Jewish couple and how they’re scamming the community again isn’t met with a million laughs.

27.author: dairy_free_bacon
27.body:
lmfaoooo!

omfg, you are literally pathetic. 

bending over backwards to be a victim.

creating a whole new narrative before my very eyes.

critical thinking skills? what are those?

good luck going through life like that. 

jfc
